channel.title: [c4d] render setting's help
channel.description:
its worth a shot askin here aswell i guess.
dose any 1 know whats up with my shadowing, or how to set up render setting for the best result
iv made an example to show u how bad it is
[IMG]http://i361.photobucket.com/albums/oo55/ssaakick/wtf-1.jpg[/img]
i just need to know the best setting for the best quality result please
Thnaks

item.title: [c4d] render setting's help
item.dc:creator: @soalreaver soalreaver
item.description:
@soalreaver wrote:

ok, cheers, ill give that a try later on when i re open my client

Read full topic

item.title: [c4d] render setting's help
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

render - render settings

global illumination (check it) choose stochastic in drop down menu.

edit the stochastic samples for faster rendering. It will give it a grainy look the less you use, usually 80 is fine.

dim the light before render.

Read full topic

item.title: [c4d] render setting's help

item.title: [c4d] render setting's help
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

R11 or R10?

And try global illumination, youâ€™d have to dim the light though.

Or try global illumination but set it to stochastic.

Read full topic
